1478149135211585538.text: ✅Passed legislation into law to enhance cybersecurity assistance to K-12 educational institutions across the country.

1478149133974347779.text: ✅Helped pass the #AmericanRescuePlan to provide much-needed resources to Michigan families, small businesses & communities impacted by the #COVID19 pandemic—including $50 billion I helped secure as Chair of @HSGAC to dramatically expand vaccine distribution.

1478149132745428995.text: ✅Secured DoD’s long-term commitment to MI & over $144 million for military facilities across Michigan in the annual defense bill.

1478149131541614597.text: ✅The @USCG National Center of Expertise—which I helped create—announced it will be headquartered in Michigan to examine freshwater oil spill response & clean-up.

1478149130241417222.text: ✅As Chair of @HSGAC, examined how Michiganders have been affected by PFAS contamination and held @DeptofDefense accountable for their failure to alert servicemembers about PFAS exposure from military sites.

1478149129029267457.text: ✅Secured $500 million in funding for my bipartisan STORM Act—to help communities w/ flooding, shoreline erosion & rising water levels.

1478149127695388680.text: ✅Helped pass the bipartisan infrastructure law that will rebuild Michigan's roads & bridges, expand high-speed internet access & protect the Great Lakes.

We had a secure, free & fair election certified by Michigan & every other state. Despite what transpired, Congress reconvened & completed the Electoral College vote count.
 
There is no question that Joe Biden & Kamala Harris will be sworn into office on January 20th.

1347139075069931523.text: It was horrific that as members carried out their constitutional duty they were threatened and disrupted by armed rioters in a desperate attempt to keep President Trump in power.

1347139074390437889.text: The President’s continued refusal to accept the election results & efforts to stoke violence demonstrates his complete absence of leadership and character. His words and actions incited domestic terrorists who endangered democratically elected leaders, staff and law enforcement.

1347139073694199814.text: Wednesday’s dangerous and unacceptable attack on our Capitol marked one of the darkest days in our nation’s history. These events went against the very values upon which our country was founded.

1346921192926580736.text:
I am safe, sheltering in a secure location and will continue to follow the guidance of the Capitol Police.
 
Today’s attacks on the Capitol are dangerous, unacceptable and an attack on our democracy—and must stop.

1346824912162484225.text: While today’s expected election challenges will test our democracy yet again, one thing is certain: Joe Biden will be sworn in on January 20.

1346824911067770881.text: Democracy is not guaranteed. We must fight to protect it along with the integrity of our elections. We must stand up against efforts that seek to disenfranchise voters in Michigan & across the country and ensure we do not weaken our standing around the world.

1346824909201268740.text:
These efforts to challenge the election results — certified by EVERY state & the Electoral College — are dangerous, destructive and irresponsible.
 
These challenges will fail but can still do tremendous damage.

1126907952764473344.text:
Judge Damon Keith, who coined the phrase "democracies die behind closed doors", will be remembered for his dedication to upholding the Constitution & his commitment to justice. 

It was an honor to lead this resolution that passed the Senate honoring his life and legacy.

1126907951388741632.text: He received more than 40 honorary degrees as well as the Spingarn Medal from the @NAACP, the highest honor awarded by the organization, & the Edward J. Devitt Distinguished Service to Justice Award, the highest award that can be bestowed on a member of the Federal judiciary.

1126907949895565312.text: In Garrett v. City of Hamtramck, Judge Keith ruled against housing discrimination & ordered the city to relocate approximately 500 African Americans who had been displaced by federally supported urban renewal projects.

1126907947928440832.text: In a 1970 decision, Judge Keith upheld the civil rights of students in Pontiac, Michigan, when he ordered a bus policy and new boundaries for Pontiac schools in order to end racial segregation.

1126907946447921152.text: Judge Keith served as one of the first cochairmen of the Michigan Civil Rights Commission at its inception in 1964, where he worked to oppose discrimination and enforce equal protection under the law.

1126907943499247616.text:
Thread: Judge Damon Keith will forever be remembered as one of the finest public servants the State of Michigan has ever known. 
His commitment to justice, civil rights & the rule of law made a difference in the lives of countless Michiganders & Americans. https://t.co/k8PWFJiyGQ https://t.co/EQ07bXElZj
